If the previous term is odd, the next term is 3 times the previous term plus 1. The conjecture is that no matter what value of n, the sequence will always reach 1. Note: 1. Collatz(1) is {1}. 2. returned vector sorted in increasing order. <|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that takes integers, floats, or strings representing
real numbers, and returns the larger variable in its given variable type.
Return "None" if the values are equal.
Note: If a real number is represented as a string, the floating point might be. or,

compareOne(1, 2.5) ➞ 2.5
compareOne(1, "2,3") ➞ "2,3"
compareOne("5,1", "6") ➞ "6"
compareOne("1", 1) ➞ "None"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
using namespace std;
boost::any compareOne(boost::any a,boost::any b){
  if(a==b)
    return a;
  if(a==boost::any(""))
    return b;
  if(b==boost::any(""))
    return a;
  if(a.type()==b.type()){
    switch(a.type()){
    case boost::any :: INT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<int>(),b.as<int>()));
    case boost::any :: FLOAT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<float>(),b.as<float>()));
    case boost::any :: STRING:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<string>(),b.as<string>()));
    default:
      return boost::any("");
    }
  }
  else if(a.type()==boost::any :: STRING){
    switch(b.type()){
    case boost::any :: INT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<string>(),b.as<int>()));
    case boost::any :: FLOAT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<string>(),b.as<float>()));
    case boost::any :: STRING:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<string>(),b.as<string>()));
    default:
      return boost::any("");
    }
  }
  else if(a.type()==boost::any :: FLOAT){
    switch(b.type()){
    case boost::any :: INT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<float>(),b.as<int>()));
    case boost::any :: FLOAT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<float>(),b.as<float>()));
    case boost::any :: STRING:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<string>(),b.as<string>()));
    default:
      return boost::any("");
    }
  }
  else if(a.type()==boost::any :: INT){
    switch(b.type()){
    case boost::any :: INT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<int>(),b.as<int>()));
    case boost::any :: FLOAT:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<float>(),b.as<float>()));
    case boost::any :: STRING:
      return boost::any(std::max(a.as<string>(),b.as<string>()));
    default:
      return boost::any("");
    }
  }
  else
    return boost::any("");
}

Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allPrefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> allPrefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            prefixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allSuffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c", "bca"}
*/
vector<string> allSuffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    for(int i=str.size()-1;i>=0;i--){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            suffixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }
    }
    return suffixes;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> stringToMd5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string stringToMd5(string text){
    MD5_CTX md5;
    MD5_Init(&md5);
    MD5_Update(&md5, text.c_str(), text.size());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &md5);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double zero=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]==0)
        {
            zero=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true is vector elements are monotonically increasing or decreasing.
>>> monotonic({1, 2, 4, 20})
true
>>> monotonic({1, 20, 4, 10})
false
>>> monotonic({4, 1, 0, -10})
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
bool monotonic(vector<float> l){
    float min = l[0];
    float max = l[0];
    for(int i = 1; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] < min){
            min = l[i];
        }
        if(l[i] > max){
            max = l[i];
        }
    }
    return max >= min;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function encrypt that takes a string as an argument and
returns a string encrypted with the alphabet being rotated. 
The alphabet should be rotated in a manner such that the letters 
shift down by two multiplied to two places.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string encrypt(string s){
    string ans = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < s.length(); i++){
        ans += (s[i] - 'a' + 2) % 26 + 'a';
    }
    return ans;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling maximum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingMax({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingMax(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int maxValue = numbers[0];
    int currentMaxValue = maxValue;
    int currentIndex = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] > maxValue){
            currentMaxValue = maxValue;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
        if(numbers[i] > currentMaxValue){
            currentMaxValue = numbers[i];
            currentIndex = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(currentMaxValue);
    result.push_back(numbers[currentIndex]);
    return result;
}
/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling minimum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingMin({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 2, 1, 2, 2, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingMin(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int minValue = numbers[0];
    int currentMinValue = minValue;
    int currentIndex = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] < minValue){
            currentMinValue = minValue;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
        if(numbers[i] < currentMinValue){
            currentMinValue = numbers[i];
            currentIndex = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(currentMinValue);
    result.push_back(numbers[currentIndex]);
    return result;
}
/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling sum (sum of all elements) found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingSum({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingSum(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    int currentSum = 0;
    int currentIndex = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
        if(sum > currentSum){
            currentSum = sum;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
        if(sum < currentSum){
            currentSum = sum;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(currentSum);
    result.push_back(numbers[currentIndex]);
    return result;
}
/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling product (product of all elements) found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingProduct({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{6, 12, 24, 3, 6, 12, 24}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingProduct(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int product = 1;
    int currentProduct = 1;
    int currentIndex = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        product *= numbers[i];
        if(product > currentProduct){
            currentProduct = product;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
        if(product < currentProduct){
            currentProduct = product;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(currentProduct);
    result.push_back(numbers[currentIndex]);
    return result;
}
/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling variance (variance of all elements) found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingVariance({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{6, 12, 24, 3, 6, 12, 24}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingVariance(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int variance = 0;
    int currentVariance = 0;
    int currentIndex = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        variance += pow(numbers[i] - numbers[i - 1], 2);
        if(variance > currentVariance){
            currentVariance = variance;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
        if(variance < currentVariance){
            currentVariance = variance;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(currentVariance);
    result.push_back(numbers[currentIndex]);
    return result;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling product (product of all elements) found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingProduct({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{6, 12, 24, 3, 6, 12, 24}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingProduct(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int product = 1;
    int currentProduct = 1;
    int currentIndex = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        product *= numbers[i];
        if(product > currentProduct){
            currentProduct = product;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
        if(product < currentProduct){
            currentProduct = product;
            currentIndex = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(currentProduct);
    result.push_back(numbers[currentIndex]);
    return result;
}
